name: Jake Sirrom
content:
Jake Sirrom was a fair-skinned Human male from Dahvil, and the son of Gem Sirrom, who worked in the Senate of the Republic prior to the Republic's dissolution and the Galactic Empire forming in 19 BBY. Following the Galactic Senate's dissolution, Gem took her son to Bespin to start a new life, and Jake joined the Wing Guard protecting the planet's Cloud City by 3 ABY. In that year, after the Galactic Empire occupied Bespin, Sirrom was in one of Cloud City's buildings, walking along a corridor, when the city's Baron Administrator, Lando Calrissian, warned the citizens via intercom about the Imperial takeover and advised them to leave before the Imperial presence increased. During his service in the Bespin Wing Guard, Jake Sirrom wore the standard uniform and wielded a Relby-k23 blaster pistol.
Portrayed by an uncredited Martin Dew, Jake Sirrom first appeared in the 1997 Special Edition release of Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back, an original trilogy film that came out in 1980. On March 11, 2014, he was first named by the article "Rogues Gallery: The Cloud City Wing Guards" published in the Star Wars Insider magazine's 148th issue.
